citation.article-title: Cellulolytic and dextranolytic Gram-negative bacteria: revival of the genus Cellvibrio.

p.s: Cellvibrio (Cell. vibii.o, cell an abbreviation of cellulose which is degraded; L.v. vibrio to vibrate; M.L. masc. n. Cellvibrio cellulose degrading vibrio)

Description : Gram-negative, aerobic, slightly curved rods which have an oxidative metabolism of glucose and the ability to hydrolyse cellulose, The organisms have no growth factor requirements and are oxidase and catalase positive.
The moles percent G + C in the DNA is 50.1 Â± 4.0.
The type species is Cellvibrio mixtus.
